Senangnya Warga Perbatasan Krayan, Sebentar Lagi Punya Akses Jalan
02 Nov 2019, 08:35 by Uji Sukma Medianti


Foto: detikcom

Krayan - Krayan adalah nama wilayah di Kabupaten Nunukan, Kalimantan Utara. Semula, Krayan adalah sebuah kecamatan. Namun dipugar lagi menjadi lima bagian yang dibawahi oleh satu kecamatan induk bernama Krayan Induk."Di bawah Krayan Induk ada 5 kecamatan lagi dengan jumlah penduduk 19.008 jiwa yang tersebar di 89 desa," kata Camat Krayan Induk Helmi Pudaaslikar saat ditemui tim detikcom beberapa waktu lalu.Wilayah Krayan dikelilingi oleh hutan khas Kalimantan yang masih lebat nan hijau. Tempat tinggal suku Dayak Lundayeh ini berbatasan langsung dengan Malaysia tepatnya di Desa Long Midang.Mendatangi Krayan tidak semudah yang dibayangkan. Selain karena satu-satunya akses adalah melalui jalur udara, hanya pesawat jenis vilatus dan caravan saja yang baru dapat mendarat di Bandara Yuvai Semaring, Krayan.Helmi menuturkan bersamaan dengan Program Nawacita yang diusung Presiden Joko Widodo pada periode pertama yakni membangun dari pinggiran, Krayan sudah mulai bergerak ke arah perubahan.Salah satunya adalah pengerjaan akses jalan yang dapat ditembus melalui Kabupaten Malinau. "Satu-satunya akses jalan itu lewat Malinau, sebetulnya jalan sudah tembus tetapi belum bisa difungsikan untuk kendaraan-kendaraan masyarakat karena masih ekstrem dan terjal," kata Helmi.


Pembangunan Akses Jalan di Perbatasan RI-Malaysia, Krayan Foto: Pradita Utama/detikcom

Jalan yang sedang dibangun oleh Kementerian PUPR itu dikerjakan dari Malinau. Rencananya akan tembus hingga garis perbatasan Long Midang dengan panjang kurang lebih 221 kilometer jaraknya.Ruas jalan yang akan menjadi akses darat menuju wilayah Indonesia pertama di Krayan ini akan dibangun dua titik. Titik pertama dari Malinau dan titik kedua dari perbatasan menuju Krayan. Keduanya dibangun secara bersamaan."Targetnya 2020 sudah fungsional, posisinya mobilisasi material pembangunan jalan nasional lewat situ," terangnya.Helmi bercerita, pada 2016 lalu ia hendak mengirim ambulance bantuan dari pemerintah pusat melalui Malinau. Saat itu, ia harus menggunakan bantuan alat berat untuk dapat mengangkutnya. Waktu tempuhnya pun tiga minggu."Saya mobilisasi (ambulance) dari Malinau lewat jalur darat dibantu alat-alat berat tiga unit dan tiga minggu baru masuk dan tembus di Binuan Krayan Tengah," jelasnya.


Beberapa pekerja di Bandara Yuvai Semaring Long Bawan Krayan Foto: Pradita Utama/detikcom

Selain jalan, pemerintah pusat juga melakukan revitalisasi Bandara Yuvai Semaring yang berada di ibu kota kecamatan Krayan yakni Long Bawan. Sedianya, revitalisasi bandara sudah dapat selesai dan beroperasi pada Februari 2020.Dengan begitu, diharapkan bisa menjadi katalis untuk datangnya para wisatawan ke Krayan. Sebab selama ini, turis biasanya datang melalui Malaysia.Pengerjaan fisik akses jalan yang sudah dimulai sejak 2018 lalu ini memberi berkah tersendiri buat para warga. Martin Palung (73) mengaku senang. Di usianya yang sudah kepala tujuh itu, Martin merasa terjadi perubahan yang sangat berarti di desanya."Saya senang pemerintah akhirnya bangun jalan raya, bangun tiang listrik. Berarti program membangun dari pinggiran itu benar dilakukan Pak Jokowi," ungkapnya.Sementara Nosnaima (43) mengaku akan mengembangkan usaha home stay di Long Midang yang berbatasan langsung dengan patok perbatasan. Apalagi dalam waktu dekat juga, ada rencana pembangunan Pos Lintas Batas Negara (PLBN) di Long Midang."Dulu pernah punya home stay, tapi dua tahun terakhir ini sepi wisatawan yang datang, saya juga ndak tahu kenapa. Kalau jalan sudah dibuka dan mau dibangun PLBN saya yakin akan datang lagi wisatawan," ujarnya.Sejalan dengan optimisme warga, Sekretaris Daerah Kabupaten Nunukan Serfianus mengatakan pemerintah daerah memang tengah memaksimalkan potensi pariwisata di Nunukan. Khusu untuk Krayan, fokusnya akan dijadikan sebagai wisata ecotourism."Kalau sudah mudah aksesibilitasnya Krayan akan masuk ke eco tourism. Begitu juga soal etnis. Sebab di Nunukan ini multi etnis, ini potensi yang bisa kita jual," kata Serfianus dalam kesempatan terpisah.Ia juga optimis dengan dibangunnya PLBN, selain akan meningkatkan pengamanan hadirnya PLBN juga bisa meningkatkan potensi ekonomi pariwisata di Kabupaten Nunukan."Kami ingin (program) ini dilanjutkan, kami mendengar statement Pak Jokowi dalam RPJMN 2020-2024 masih akan fokus di bidang infrastruktur. Ini penting sekali masalah konektivitas. Menekan inflasi, distribusi barang lebih mudah pelayanan pemerintah juga lebih mudah," pungkasnya.detikcom bersama PLN mengadakan program Tapal Batas yang mengulas mengenai perkembangan infrastruktur listrik, perekonomian, pendidikan, pertahanan dan keamanan, hingga budaya serta pariwisata di beberapa wilayah terdepan.Ikuti terus berita tentang ekspedisi di pulau-pulau terdepan Indonesia di tapalbatas.detik.com! Delighted Krayan Border Residents, Soon to Have Road Access
02 Nov 2019, 08:35 by Uji Sukma Medianti


Photo: detikcom

Krayan - Krayan is the name of the region in Nunukan Regency, North Kalimantan. Originally, Krayan was a district. But it was restored to five parts under one parent sub-district named Krayan Induk. "Under Krayan Paruk there are 5 more sub-districts with a population of 19,008 people spread in 89 villages," said Krayan Induk Sub-District Helmi Pudaaslikar when met by the AFP team some time ago. The Krayan region is surrounded by typical Kalimantan forests that are still dense and green. The residence of the Dayak Lundayeh tribe is directly adjacent to Malaysia precisely in the village of Long Midang. Visiting Krayan is not as easy as imagined. Besides being the only access is by air, only vilatus and caravan aircraft can land at Yuvai Semaring Airport, Krayan. Helmi said along with the Nawacita Program carried by President Joko Widodo in the first period, namely building from the periphery, Krayan had began to move towards change. One of them was the work of access roads that could be penetrated through Malinau District. "The only access road is through Malinau, the road is actually transparent but cannot be used for public vehicles because it is still extreme and steep," Helmi said.


Development of Road Access at the RI-Malaysia Border, Krayan Photo: Pradita Utama / detikcom

The road that is being built by the Ministry of Public Works and Housing is being worked on from Malinau. The plan will be to penetrate to the Long Midang border line with a length of approximately 221 kilometers. The road that will be the land access to the first Indonesian territory in Krayan will be built in two points. The first point from Malinau and the second point from the border to Krayan. "The target for 2020 is functional, the position is the mobilization of national road construction materials through it," he explained. Helmi said, in 2016 he wanted to send ambulance assistance from the central government through Malinau. At that time, he had to use heavy equipment to be able to transport it. The travel time was three weeks. "I mobilized (ambulance) from Malinau by land, assisted by heavy equipment, three units and three weeks after entering and penetrating Central Binuan Krayan," he explained.


Some workers at Yuvai Semaring Airport Long Bawan Krayan Photo: Pradita Utama / detikcom

In addition to roads, the central government is also revitalizing the Yuvai Semaring Airport in the capital of the Krayan sub-district, Long Bawan. Originally, the airport revitalization could be completed and operational in February 2020. Thus, it is expected to be a catalyst for the arrival of tourists to Krayan. Because all this time, tourists usually come through Malaysia. The physical work of the access road, which began in 2018, has given its residents a blessing. Martin Palung (73) said he was happy. At the age of seven, Martin felt that there was a very significant change in his village. "I am glad that the government has finally built a highway, built electricity poles. This means that the building program from the outskirts was really carried out by Mr. Jokowi," he said. claimed to be developing a home stay business in Long Midang which borders directly with the border marker. Especially in the near future, there is a plan to build a Cross-border State Post (PLBN) in Long Midang. "Previously, I had a home stay, but the last two years have been empty of tourists who come, I also don't know why. If the road has been opened and wants to be built I'm sure tourists will come again, "he said. In line with the optimism of residents, the Regional Secretary of Nunukan Regency Serfianus said that the regional government is indeed maximizing the tourism potential in Nunukan. Especially for Krayan, the focus will be on ecotourism tourism. "If it's easy, Krayan will go into eco tourism. So is the issue of ethnicity. Because in Nunukan it is multi-ethnic, this is a potential that we can sell," said Serfianus on a separate occasion. also optimistic that with the construction of the PLBN, in addition to increasing the security of the presence of the PLBN, it can also increase the economic potential of tourism in Nunukan Regency. "We want to continue this program, we hear that Mr. Jokowi's statement in the 2020-2024 RPJMN will still focus on infrastructure. This is important once the problem of connectivity. Reducing inflation, easier distribution of goods government services are also easier, "he concluded. detikcom with PLN held a Border Program that reviews the development of electricity infrastructure, the economy, education, defense and security, to culture and tourism in some leading regions .Follow the news about the expedition in the foremost islands of Indo nesia at tapalbatas.detik.com!
